subject: Re: [junit] assertTrue(true)
msgSnippet: Chris Dollin  wrote: ... Why not make the pass() method more useful by implementing it like this: protected void pass() { wasHere++; }
messageBody:
Chris Dollin <kers@...> wrote:
On Tuesday 31 May 2005 20:04, John Smith wrote:
>> Of course methods like pass() or
>> assertTrue(true) are a kind of documentation.

>Exactly; and the more so the former than the latter.

Why not make the pass() method more useful by implementing it like this:

protected void pass()
{
wasHere++;
}

Just Joking...
